column1: Vladimir Alekseyevich Solovyov (Russian: ????????? ??????????? ????????; born November 11, 1946) is a former Soviet cosmonaut.
His first flight, Soyuz T-10, took off on February 8, 1984, to join Salyut 7.

column2: The crew spent ten months (nearly 237 days) performing numerous medical and space manufacturing experiments.

column1: They came down aboard Soyuz T-11 on October 2, 1984.
Solovyov then became the Mir flight director (Russian Mission Control) for several years.
He retired on February 18, 1994 but came back to head the Russian segment of the International Space Station (ISS).
Solovyov is married and has two children.
